pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:0.5.eng: The second training rule on unmarried girls

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to unmarried girls who were more than twenty years old, but who had not trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.4.pli: na jānanti kappiyaṃ vā akappiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.4.eng: and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.5.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.5.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.6.eng: “How can nuns give the full admission to unmarried girls who are more than twenty years old, but who haven’t trained for two years in the six rules?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.13.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.14.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, aṭṭhārasavassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.14.eng: “Monks, approval is required for an unmarried girl who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.15.eng: And the approval is to be given like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.16.pli: Tāya aṭṭhārasavassāya kumāribhūtāya saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhunīnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.16.eng: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that unmarried girl who is eighteen years old should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.17.pli: ‘ahaṃ, ayye, itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya aṭṭhārasavassā kumāribhūtā saṅghaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.17.eng: ‘Venerables, I, so-and-so, an unmarried girl who is eighteen years old, am training under Venerable so-and-so. I ask the Sangha for approval to train for two years in the six rules.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.17.comm: Itthannāmāya ayyāya is probably the genitive case, which would literally mean that the trainee nun “belongs” to her teacher. I take this to be an indirect reference to being her student.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.18.eng: And she should ask a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.20.eng: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.21.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.22.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya aṭṭhārasavassā kumāribhūtā saṅghaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.22.eng: This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.23.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmāya aṭṭhārasavassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.23.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.25.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.26.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya aṭṭhārasavassā kumāribhūtā saṅghaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.26.eng: This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.27.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmāya aṭṭhārasavassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiṃ deti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.27.eng: The Sangha gives approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.28.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya aṭṭhārasavassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammutiyā dānaṃ, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.28.eng: Any nun who approves of giving approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.29.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.30.pli: Dinnā saṅghena itthannāmāya aṭṭhārasavassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhāsammuti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.30.eng: The Sangha has given approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.31.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.31.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.32.pli: Sā aṭṭhārasavassā kumāribhūtā evaṃ vadehīti vattabbā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.32.eng: That unmarried girl who is eighteen years old should be told to say this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.33.pli: “pāṇātipātā veramaṇiṃ dve vassāni avītikkamma samādānaṃ samādiyāmi …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.33.eng: ‘I undertake to abstain from killing living beings for two years without transgression. …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.34.pli: vikālabhojanā veramaṇiṃ dve vassāni avītikkamma samādānaṃ samādiyāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.34.eng: I undertake to abstain from eating at the wrong time for two years without transgression.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.35.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tā bhikkhuniyo anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.35.eng: Then, after rebuking those nuns in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.36.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.36.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.37.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:1.37.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old, but who has not trained in the six rules for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.5.eng: Who is more than twenty years old:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.6.eng: who has reached twenty years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.8.eng: a novice nun is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.12.pli: sikkhā vā na dinnā hoti, dinnā vā sikkhā kupitā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.12.eng: the training has not been given to her, or the training has been given to her, but she has failed in it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.15.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.15.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.16.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.16.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.17.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.18.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.19.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.19.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.20.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.21.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.22.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.23.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.24.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.25.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.27.pli: paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.27.eng: if she gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old, and who has trained in the six rules for two years;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.29.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc72:2.30.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:0.5.eng: The third training rule on unmarried girls

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were giving the full admission to unmarried girls who were more than twenty years old and who had trained in the six rules for two years, but who had not been approved by the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.4.pli: “etha, sikkhamānā, imaṃ jānātha, imaṃ detha, imaṃ āharatha, iminā attho, imaṃ kappiyaṃ karothā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.4.eng: “Come, trainee nuns, find out about this,” “Give this,” “Bring this,” “There’s need for this,” or “Make this allowable.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.6.eng: “Venerables, we’re not trainee nuns. We’re nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.8.eng: “How can nuns give the full admission to unmarried girls who are more than twenty years old and who have trained for two years in the six rules, but who haven’t been approved by the Sangha?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.15.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.16.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, paripuṇṇavīsativassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ dātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.16.eng: “Monks, approval is required for the full admission of an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.17.eng: And the approval is to be given like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.18.pli: Tāya paripuṇṇavīsativassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhikkhunīnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.18.eng: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.19.pli: ‘ahaṃ, ayye, itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇavīsativassā kumāribhūtā dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhā saṅghaṃ vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ yācāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.19.eng: ‘Venerables, I, the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, ask the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.20.eng: And she should ask a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.22.eng: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.23.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.24.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇavīsativassā kumāribhūtā dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhā saṅghaṃ vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.24.eng: This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.25.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ saṅgho itthannāmāya paripuṇṇavīsativassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ dadeyya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.25.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.27.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.28.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā itthannāmāya ayyāya paripuṇṇavīsativassā kumāribhūtā dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhā saṅghaṃ vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ yācati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.28.eng: This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.29.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmāya paripuṇṇavīsativassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiṃ deti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.29.eng: The Sangha gives approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.30.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya paripuṇṇavīsativassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammutiyā dānaṃ, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.30.eng: Any nun who approves of giving approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.31.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.32.pli: Dinnā saṅghena itthannāmāya paripuṇṇavīsativassāya kumāribhūtāya dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya vuṭṭhānasammuti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.32.eng: The Sangha has given approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.33.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.33.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.34.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tā bhikkhuniyo anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.34.eng: Then, after rebuking those nuns in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.35.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.35.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.36.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:1.36.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.5.eng: Who is more than twenty years old:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.6.eng: who has reached twenty years of age.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.8.eng: a novice nun is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.12.eng: who has trained in the six rules.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.14.pli: ñattidutiyena kammena vuṭṭhānasammuti na dinnā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.14.eng: approval to be fully admitted has not been given though a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.17.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.17.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.18.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.18.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.19.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.20.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.21.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.21.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.22.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.23.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.24.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.25.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.26.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.27.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.29.pli: paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.29.eng: if she gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old, who has trained in the six rules for two years, and who has been approved by the Sangha;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.31.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc73:2.32.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:0.5.eng: The training rule on less than twelve years

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo ūnadvādasavassā vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.2.eng: At that time nuns who had less than twelve years of seniority were giving the full admission.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.3.pli: Tā bālā honti abyattā na jānanti kappiyaṃ vā akappiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.3.eng: They were ignorant and incompetent, and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.4.eng: And their students too were ignorant and incompetent,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.5.pli: na jānanti kappiyaṃ vā akappiyaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.5.eng: and they too did not know what was allowable and what was not.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.7.eng: “How can nuns who have less than twelve years of seniority give the full admission?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo ūnadvādasavassā vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun who has less than twelve years of seniority gives the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.5.eng: Who has less than twelve years of seniority:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.6.eng: who has not reached twelve years of seniority.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.9.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.9.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.10.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.10.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.11.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.12.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.13.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.1.13.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.2.2.eng: if one who has twelve years of seniority gives the full admission;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc74:2.2.5.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.
